page.title: 15Buildings in SW.Cheshire.
page.content: Buildings vary considerably in age from the 15th century "Gatehouse" at Saighton to a 1970s house at Hatton Heath.Saighton village is all 19th century & many of the farmhouses are 18th or 19th century but are built in a different style being like Saighton of brick but having little decoration. Some farms have 3 storeys eg.New Russia Hall,whilst a 17th century house by Golbourne Manor,reputed to be haunted by a highwayman,has spy holes in the 1st floor for watching the police beneath.Other properties eg. Hatton Heath post office were built for much poorer people being smaller & of only 2 storeys.A fair number of houses have been modernised recently by enlarging them & covering with white painted rendering eg.on Platts Lane.There has been some 20th century building (see page 16).
